content: It appears you are composing mail in plain text format. Set HTML in Account Settings, Composition & Addressing (for each account).

content:
I'll just address a few issues:

The header pane can be adjusted with the Compact Headers add-on.

The Get Messages icon can be on the Folder Pane Header (under View/Folders) or on the toolbar with Global Search (right-click, Customize..., drag the icon onto the bar).

There is a v. 3.2 Manually sort folders that mostly works in 115.

content:
Sorry you are having trouble. Surely you are frustrated, but please keep civility in mind.

There are no widespread reports of users missing address books on update. And the tests which are in place have not seen such an issue.

Which OS are you using? Are the other address books visible and populated? Is problem still seen after Help > Troubleshoot Mode If you check Tools > Developer > Error console after startup and opening AV, is there anything address book related in the console?

content: You mentioned that you exported emails. Is that what you did or did you export the profile? The 'import from a file' works with profiles, but only if zipped. If you exported the profile itself, then you should use the tools>import>import from another Thunderbird installation. A screenshot of what you backed up may help clarify what you are wanting to import. Thank you.

content:
re :years of emails to addresses using isp-provided email addresses are in Thunderbird

There has been so many changes post 60 version, a simple copy paste of the 'Thunderbird' folder may not be the best way forward. But there are some files and folders that can be used. Do this to prepare things.

Assuming you can still run the vista OS computer.

  • Start Thunderbird
  • Create some new folders in the 'Local Folders' mail account.
  • Get 'copies' of all your emails from the various accounts put into suitably named folders in the 'Local folders' mail account.

This may take a while, so be patient.

Then it can be a simple case of using that 'Local Folders' folder in the new profile - bare with me - all will be explained later.

When this is done, you will need to get a copy of everything. Exit Thunderbird Access: - see image below as guide.

  • C://Users/User name/Appdata/Roaming folder
  • Copy the 'Thunderbird' folder to an external drive as you will need this when transfering stuff onto new computer.

The idea is to use a new profile in the latest version, but also use certain files and folders from the old profile. I'll advise which folders you can easily copy paste and which files you can 'import'.

So let me know when you have :

  1. completed all the email copying to Local Folders mail account on the old Vista computer
  2. got a backup/copy of the original 'Thunderbird' folder onto external drive.
creator: Toad-Hall
